This plugin works, but not everywhere, and this is not the worst thing about it. In fact, I have conducted a test in Figma, where I typically require additional measurements, and I have observed that this plugin yields inaccurate data. If I change the zoom of the canvas, the measuring brakes and after relaunching, the value changes compared to the previous one. Furthermore, the plugin is ineffective if the zoom level of the webpage is not 100%
Doesn't seem to work at all
this is a great one!

It sort of works and it sort of doesn't.
First you have to make sure the extension icon is lit for the site you are trying to measure.
Then you have to fight the browser. The ALT+D shortcut just highlights the address bar.
For some pages and some CSS elements it snaps to the wrong things making it useless, but for others it works fine.
YMMV

It doesn't measure distance between HTML elements (or text nodes including "line-height"). 

I was looking for a tool that snaps to HTML elements and text nodes, allowing to select two and measure distance between them no matter where on the screen they are, no matter how many other elements are in between them. 
  
This tool is very simple and measures only internal size of elements, as it detects color change. It's fine only for simple measurements.

Surely you need black objects on white background for this to work... or something that has NO shading or color hue variance, because measuring objects in photographs is impossible.  It will pick up the slightest nuance in shading and take it as a border, measuring random points within an obkect.  I have tried to measure bicycle frames, for example, and it has selected some random pixel in the middle of a tube, and another random pixel way off to the right in the white area of the screen, giv... I love how simple and effective this tool is. It does exactly what I wanted.
Can you change shortcut from Ctrl+D to anything else as Ctrl+D used for bookmarking any site in chrome browser. Please advice.
Change shortcut CMD+D to another ... with this shortcut is "Dimensions" unusable
Takes Chromes CTRL+D keyboard shortcut for add bookmark for itself.
This extension is awesome. Its shortcut is no longer conflicting with the bookmark functionality and it seems more stable.

I'd like to be able to hit escape to switch off the tool.

Also I agree with Gabriel that you should be able to choose whether to measure text to its outline or line height/bounding box.
It breaks the ability to add a bookmark...

It's very useful, but it breaks your ability to bookmark things. You can't click on the star in the address panel or use a keyboard shortcut. The workaround is to highlight the whole URL and drag it to a bookmark folder.
I'm giving it one star because they're taking a long time to fix the bug where it breaks your ability to add a bookmark!
this is nice but the one downfall is that the key binding is the same for bookmarking, I would give 4 or 5 stars if that was an option to change.

There seems to be a conflict somewhere on Macs, cmd+d no longer bookmarks websites, it activates this dimensions plugin. Can't click on the start to bookmark a page either. In general just can't bookmark when this plugin is enabled.
Plugin is useful, but ability to add bookmark seems being broken

This is one of my favourite extensions for front end development but it's pretty buggy, doesn't always work and I've had to disable it this week since it started disabling the bookmark button. When I try bookmark something this extension button is clicked instead but the extension doesn't start working. Will remain disabled until you fix it.

Love it. Just a curious question about changing shortcode key. I used to "CTRL+D" for adding a current page for bookmark for a long time. Can you tell me how do I change your extension shortcode or disable key activation? (Win7+chrome)

I really like the extension. But as others already mentioned it sometimes doesn't properly intialize. I had to disable it because it overrides the bookmark functionality.

If that gets fixed – 5 stars.

When this extension works, it's EXTREMELY useful. As a web developer for a major clothing company on the East Coast, I use this pretty much everyday. Our company provides us with MacBook Pro's, and for some reason this seems to be finicky with Retina screens. If I drag the window to my non-Retina monitor and use it, sometimes it works, and other times it just stops working, seemingly at random. 

Increase stability to something close to 99.9% and this will become a 5-star extension. Until the... Show more
